department.dept_long_name: Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Literature, Film, and Visual Arts in Russia, 1920-1930
course.description: Examines poetry, prose and visual arts together with cultural theory. Explores issues of innovation and cultural memory, art and politics, bilingualism and exile. Works by Mayakovsky, Malevich, Mandelshtam, Tsvetaeva, Babel, Shklovsky, Nabokov, Vertov, and Eisenstein.
course.prerequisites: Reading knowledge of Russian or with the permission of the instructor.
course.notes: Texts are available in English and Russian. Open to qualified undergraduates.
